title: OnTheMarket was once hot property, now it’s a doer-upper
text:
Now isn’t the best time to be on the market, at least not if you’re a shareholder in the fledgling estate agency portal. OnTheMarket hardly got off to the best start as a public company, ending 10pc down on the first day of trading, having raised just £30m of the £50m targeted.

Eighteen months after joining London’s junior Aim market its shares are now worth just half what they were, after the company slipped further into the red.

Operating losses for the last six months widened from £5.7m to £7.2m, and administrative costs spiked almost a quarter to nearly £15m on the back of investment in sales and IT.

But the biggest concern will be its dwindling cash pile, which halved from £15.7m to £8.8m...
description: Now isn’t the best time to be on the market, at least not if you’re a shareholder in the fledgling estate agency portal.
